detailed_description.textblock:
Multidisciplinary experts from two Pediatric Intensive Care Units (PICUs), used an iterative modified Delphi process to develop and refine criteria determining PICU patients for whom a family care conference would be beneficial. The investigators goal was to define a set of criteria that are highly sensitive (maximally inclusive) and reliable. The investigators have done a preliminary assessment of the criteria by retrospectively reviewing two months of PICU patient's medical records at the two participating sites. In this study the investigators assessed the reliability of the family care conference criteria by prospectively reviewing the medical records of two months of PICU patient admissions at both participating sites. The investigators will also use the information obtained to further refine the PICU family conference criteria as needed.
Primary Aim: Determine reliability of criteria for determining which PICU families to offer a family care conference.
Secondary Aim: Refine the PICU family care conference criteria
Methods: Two people per patient will extract electronic health record (EHR) data for two months at the PICUs of the two participating sites to identify patients who met one of the family care conference criteria and patients for whom a family care conference occurredâ€”the latter determined by searching the entire EHR for the terms "patient care conference", "care conference", "FC", "family meeting", and "meeting". The investigators will also extract the following patient data: age; sex; and indication for PICU admission. For patients meeting at least one of the family care conference criteria, but for whom a family care conference was not documented, a study team member will ask the patient's PICU team (either resident, fellow, APRN, PA, or attending) at the time of discharge if family care conference occurred while the patient was admitted. The goal of this effort is to identify family care conferences that occurred, but that were not documented in the EHR. The investigators will also identify patients who had a family care conferences but did not meet the criteria.
Data analysis: The investigators will calculate a kappa statistic describing agreement between the two raters' determination of which patients met at least one of our family care conference criteria. The investigators will also look at kappa statistics by site and for individual criteria to determine what influenced the overall kappa score.
Refining criteria. The study team will review and discuss criteria with a Kappa < 0.7. The investigators will modify the criteria, definition, or process for accessing those criteria as needed. The teams will also discuss patients who had a family care conference but did not meet our preliminary criteria to identify common themes and consider modifications that would improve the inclusivity of our family care conference criteria.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through PICU admission, an average of 3.5 days and up to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Reliability of Family Care Conference Criteria

criteria.textblock:
Inclusions criteria:
- All patients admitted to the PICU at the two participating sites.
- All healthcare team members (residents, fellows, APRNs, PAs, attendings) involved the care of PICU patients.
Exclusion criteria:
- None
